options.title: -a
options.description: Each name is an indexed array variable (see Arrays).

options.title: -A
options.description: Each name is an associative array variable (see Arrays).

options.title: -i
options.description: The variable is to be treated as an integer; arithmetic evaluation (see Shell Arithmetic) is performed when the variable is assigned a value.

options.title: -l
options.description: When the variable is assigned a value, all upper-case characters are converted to lower-case. The upper-case attribute is disabled.

options.title: -n
options.description: Give each name the nameref attribute, making it a name reference to another variable. That other variable is defined by the value of name. All references, assignments, and attribute modifications to name, except for those using or changing the -n attribute itself, are performed on the variable referenced by nameâ€™s value. The nameref attribute cannot be applied to array variables.

options.title: -r
options.description: Make names readonly. These names cannot then be assigned values by subsequent assignment statements or unset.

options.title: -t
options.description: Give each name the trace attribute. Traced functions inherit the DEBUG and RETURN traps from the calling shell. The trace attribute has no special meaning for variables.

options.title: -u
options.description: When the variable is assigned a value, all lower-case characters are converted to upper-case. The lower-case attribute is disabled.

options.title: -x
options.description: Mark each name for export to subsequent commands via the environment.
